newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore bunkers little changed in quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: Singapore bunkers little changed in quiet trade.

text.p: Singapore bunker quotes were little changed with few enquiries amid usual thin Monday activity, traders said.

Crude losses slightly discouraged the market though overall sentiment was still supported by recent slow off-port-limit bunkering, they said. "Demand within the port did improve but it's Monday, so there are not many enquiries," said one trader. The 380-cst grade was offered at around $99/$101 per tonne and the 180-cst was at about $103. MDO and gas oil were also stable, quoted at around $160 and $173 per tonne respectively.
